index.title: Linkliste + über die Seite and Projekte
index.preword:
This is the linklist, or alternative home. Sitemap would may be a good name, but it contains 'external' links too.
It contains also a description about the website and my in context to my projects.
index.description:
TEXT IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION! This is a little link-collection.
It is using your webstorage to provide this site also offline when supported by your browser.
This site is very current and i will update it and try to learn something about this relative new HTML5-Stuff. Also javascript is really new to me, but it's a funny world. Not a 'secure' language or so, but funny and sometimes usefull (see map-plugin in Peta).
On the other site i like some more serious and mostly OOP and MVC-Structred Code. On this site you could became a overview of the projects, which exists out of this. I see a important point in security for my applications, so 2 of the Projects got encryption too. The last is written in PHP and is not encrypted in db yet - but this will follow, as i find time. It will look similiar implemented to the other projects.
The last part is about me. I like to have some money too and have done a education as applicationdeveloper. After education i worked by body, cause 4 years 8 hours a day computer was too much! Now i broke my feet, and wanted to do something - i never really ended programming (just reduced a lot!), but since April, as you could see on github, i'm really active again! I dont want donations, this should be a example, in which direction i could develop.
You could use them freely and i'm happy when someone fork or contribute it
Also Bugreportings are nice (then i see work's not unused :))

tryToxic.title: tryToxic
tryToxic.preword: tryToxic ist einfach ein weiterer tox-api-client. Er ist in python3 und pyQt geschrieben.

features.Local encryption: Store messages and idendity encrypted on harddisk
features.Gruppenchates: Lade leute in welche ein oder kreire selbst welche
features.Loglevel einstellen: Verändere das Loglevel im laufenden Betrieb.
features.I18N: Es ist für alle Sprachen vorbereitet

jobManagement.title: jobManagement
jobManagement.preword: Semantische Job-übersicht wenn du für verschiedene Firmen arbeitest (z.B freelancer oder temporär).Geschrieben in python3 mit pyQt und pyCrypto.

features.Lokale Verschlüsselung: Alle Daten können lokal verschlüsselt werden
features.Verschiedene Firmen: When you work for diffrent companys
features.Loglevel einstellen: Verändere das Loglevel im laufenden Betrieb.
features.I18N: Es ist für alle Sprachen vorbereitet

peta.title: peta
peta.preword: Der Name Peta kommt von PhpmETA. Es ist vor allem in PHP 5.5 geschrieben und bedient sich smarty (template/.tpl-files) und dojo (Javascript). Die Idee hinter diesem Projekt ist, redundantes schreiben von Code zu verhinden. Ein Hauptziel ist eine gute Struktur, in dem ein Administrator schnell und unkompliziert arbeiten kann.. Das letztendliche Ziel ist eine Basis für alles.

features.Flexibles Pluginsystem: Jedes Plugin kann eine bis n Instanzen erstellen
features.Flexibles Zugriffssystem: Jeder Benutzer hat eine bis n Rollen. Jedes instanzierte Plugin hat eine bis n Rollen mit einem r/rw/admin-recht.
features.MVC-Struktur: Es sollte einfach sein, sich den Code anzueignen oder ein Plugin zu schreiben.

bugs.Update accessrights: Set ar fails on update, so rm ant touch!

about.title: Über mich
about.description: Hello, i am jad (just another developer), playing with json right now.

PHP.desc: Use this for a long time now. Since Oop is default with PHP5, it's beatiful to use.

frameworks.Smarty: Templateframework, allow a clean separation between 'controller' and 'view'

Python.desc: Python is a little more fresh language i've learned, but it's make addicted really fast. Perfect possibilitys of sequentell, Oop and modulare code.

frameworks.PyQt: Qt is a very modular ui-library - it's easy to use and works very stable
frameworks.PyTox: PyTox is a interface to the tox-core-project. For further information visit http://tox.im
frameworks.PyCrypto: PyCrypto supports many kinds of hashing, symmetric and asymmetric encryptions. I basicly use it to encrypt the local storage

Java.desc: Learned this language at education. JVM was/is a really bloating runtime, what i dislike. It's strictly needed Oop-kind was nice for learning. Since Android was growing very much last years and dalvik seems to be very optimized, i may go back to this language once.

Javascript.desc: In past, this language was a example why you should do it static for me. So much incompatibility between browsers! Today, it's changed, a lot of stuff is default, there are mighty js-frameworks and there came html5. Look the source of this page ;)
